title: Louisville Metropolitan Police Department Firearm Seizure Data, 2012-2024 (Louisville Metro Police Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Kentucky Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All available records of firearms seized, confiscated by or surrendered to the Louisville Metro Police Department (LMPD) from 2012 to 2024. 

1. Proof of Existing Public Records (Prior Release)
This request builds upon the previously published dataset titled:
“Louisville Metro KY – Firearm Data normalized addresses January 1st 2010 – February 22nd 2017”
https://catalog.data.gov/dataset/louisville-metro-ky-firearm-data-normalized-addresses-january-1st-2010-february-22nd-2017
That dataset, which contains firearm recovery records with structured fields (e.g., FIREARMS_MODEL, FIREARMS_CALIBER, RECOVERY_DATE, UCR_CATEGORY), serves as proof of concept that such records exist, are regularly collected by LMPD, and have previously been released to the public.

2. Records Requested
I request all available firearm seizure or intake records collected by LMPD, including but not limited to the time span before and after the dataset above.
Please include fields such as:
FIREARMS_MAKE
FIREARMS_MODEL
FIREARMS_CALIBER
RECOVERY_DATE (date seized or recovered)
UCR_CATEGORY (associated crime or offense type)
Any additional firearm-specific attributes (e.g., serial number, type, manufacturer)
I am not requesting address or location data.

3. Preferred Format
Please provide the records in machine-readable formats (e.g. CSV, Excel, or similar), including the full data schema or data dictionary.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andy Friedman
